Description: An angel holding a sword with bodies beneath him, from an album lettered "STUDIO/DI DISSEGNI/DI GIACOMO/PALMA" on the front cover, containing 136 drawings of mainly religious subjects; the angel killing the firstborn in Egypt Pen and brown ink and brown wash, over black chalk Verso: A flying angel seen from behind, and a man falling Pen and brown ink
Curator's comments: See Curator's Comment for 1862.0809.1. A related drawing of horizontal format is in the Correr album (exhib. cat., 1990, no. 54b, p. 136). Stefania Mason Rinaldi dates the drawings to the first decade of the 17th century. A fragmentary study for the same composition is on the verso of 1862,0809.125 in the BM album. Lit.: S. Mason Rinaldi, exhib. cat., Venice, Museo Correr, 1990, under no. 54b, p. 136
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Antonio Maria Zanetti I
